ygData.subject: Re: General grousing
ygData.msgSnippet: Shando, No I dont see a problem with this but if you wish to RP your monk maybe you should not buy anything but only use what items you loot yourself. this way
ygData.messageBody:
Shando,

No I dont see a problem with this but if you wish to RP your monk maybe you
should not buy anything but only use what items you loot yourself. this way
you would not have to save up so much money. Another thoguht is that those
bracers come off of a difficult Mob in Lguk. at level 16 you werent
"supposed" to have those. Back at level 16 when E-marr was still new and the
highest playes were only in there low 30's noone had those bracers. People
on the server didnt even know where they came from. I Think I was wearing
woven still at that point. dont dispair because you dont have level 30
equipment at level 16. you will get it eventually.

Kizmet Bayashi
Monk of the 46th ....
E-Marr
Da`Kor

"Good things come to those monks who wait"


----- Original Message -----
From: James W Hooper <jhooper@...>
To: <EQ_Monk@onelist.com>; <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, December 08, 1999 11:46 AM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] General grousing


> From: James W Hooper <jhooper@...>
>
> I have always thought that monks should be characters of moderation and
> poverty. I have tried to play my character that way. I have managed to
> squrriel away 250 pp. I figured that would handle most of my expenses for
> the foreseeable future. I buy muffins and water for food and drink. All
> of my magic tiems have been given to me or looted off of drops. However,
I
> have reached an impasse. Someone last night was auctioning off Serpent
> bracers. When I asked how much, I was shocked to hear 800 pp. I guess
> that I am going to have to break down and loot everything or hope that I
> stumble across a raqre drop. I am not going to be able to afford anything
> better if I don't do so. I think it is sad, that if I am going to be a
> successful adventurer, I am going to have to be like the rest of the money
> grubbing classes: Rogues, Shadow Knights, Warriors, Druids, Shamans,
> Rangers, Bards, Enchanters, Wizards, Magicians, Necromancers, holy
> Clerics and pious Paladins. Does anyone else see a problem with this?
>
> Shando, 16th level, Silent Fist Clan
> Bertoxxulous
>
> >
